title: Police officer run down by car in Tottenham
text:
A police officer has been airlifted to hospital after being run down by a vehicle in Tottenham, north London.

Officers were conducting a stop and search of a vehicle at White Hart Lane at 11.32am on Tuesday when the car drove off at speed before colliding with an officer.

The injured officer was airlifted to hospital and is believed to have suffered a broken leg. Updates on his condition are expected.

Investigations are currently underway and there have been no arrests.

A statement released by Metropolitan Police said: "At 11:32hrs on Tuesday, 29 October, officers conducted the stop of a vehicle at White Hart Lane, Tottenham.

"The suspect vehicle stopped for police, but then drove off at speed colliding with an officer.

"The London Ambulance Service and London’s Air Ambulance attended.

"The officer has been taken to hospital. We await an update on his condition. There have been no arrests.

"Enquiries are underway to locate the suspects and the vehicle."
description: A police officer has been airlifted to hospital after being run down by a vehicle in Tottenham, north London.
